website_summaries.verdict: More than just a point-and-shoot pocket megazoom, the Canon SX200 IS improves upon its forerunner, but not by much.
pros: Compact body with wide-angle lens with 12x zoom
very good photo and video quality for its class
cons: no optical zoom in Movie mode

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX200IS
customer_reviews.text: After researching this camera and reading rave reviews, I replaced my point and shoot with this model. This camera makes beautiful crisp outdoor pics. But like any point and shoot, indoors, if the subject is too far away for the flash to reach(approx 15ft), not going to get the shot. I was however able to make some beautiful video of my child's recital from the back of the room, great zoom for video. Sound quality great. Pop up flash is a bit of a bother as it pops up everytime the camera is turned on. Easily hooks up to hdtv for viewing. A little bulkier than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: GinaAmara

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera - Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I believe I caught this camera as the model was being discontinued, and I couldn't be happier. The price was fantastic and the only design flaw I don't care for is the spring loaded flash that pops up goes easily unnoticed before you turn the camera on. Just from the natural way of holding the camera, the flash can be held down by your fingers and cannot deploy. A small issue when you see the quality of pictures, especially in low light settings.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for its price
customer_reviews.text: I must say, for a camera at this price im quite pleased. Ive had this camera for over a year now and its still working okay. the reason i say "okay" is because the picture quality seems to be diminishing. Lots of noise is created when zoomed in above 12X or when the ISO is set above 400 (i find this very disappointing) Taking pictures at 48X zoom or 1600 ISO is pretty much useless I however, edit my photos on Photoshop to reduce the noise and improve the overall quality, see for yourself: [...]
customer_reviews.author: Fabricio Marin

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with great manual features
customer_reviews.text: Everything to love about this camera. Only had it a month so durability is still unknown. Already made it through a backpacking trip and some family events. Small enough for my pockets, but I'm a big guy with big pockets. If you are looking to do manual adjustments and create your own style then this camera will work for you. Plus the zoom is great, easy to control and digital zoom can be turned off witch is great. Wish there was a traditional view finder, but those are hard to find today. Great camera, Cannon is easy to understand and well made.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera in such a small package. Only complaint is that the dial on top to change shooting modes is hard to read (symbols are small and not intuitive). With time you get used to it, but other cameras are easier to select modes with. Pictures are fantastic. Great picture quality in automatic mode, but also lots of flexibility for more advanced photographers.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Pleased thus far!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a simple point and shoot kind of girl and this camera delivers! So happy I didn't go with another camera, my CANON is excellent. No horror stories...yet, just beautiful, clear, crips, beautiful images. And that's just point and shoot! Can't wait to figure out all the bells and whistles. Whenever I show friends pics, they always ask what kind of camera I'm using.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Brown

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am not a professional photographer, but I wanted a nice camera with me when I went on a trip to Europe. The Cannon Powershot SX 200 IS has more than served me well. It takes outstanding pictures, and the built in panorama stitching mode works wonderfully! I also love the look of this camera, it is gorgeous and the perfect compromise between compact size and a full set of features. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone that is not a professional but still wants a camera that is capable of taking the very best pictures.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera - small enough to take everywhere, great optical zoom (12x), great image quality, and manual overrides for great control. We own two of these - my husband uses the automatic settings most of the time, but finds it easy enough to try other settings & modes. We hike a lot, and find that the battery lasts several days, even when we are shooting pictures all day long. The still image quality is outstanding; have not used the hd video so can't speak to that. Would recommend this camera to anyone who wants high-quality images without lugging along a bulkier SLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: Olympia

customer_reviews.title: great camera. takes the best pictures even on auto
customer_reviews.text: great camera. takes the best pictures even on auto. makes a unexperienced user look great. but the pop up flash is a little difficult to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: tnicholson10

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a perfect camera for my uses!
customer_reviews.text: I have worked my way through at least 5 cameras, used while traveling and for recording family events. I always wanted at least a little more zoom capacity, while retaining clarity and ease of taking pictures. This one fulfills my wishes perfectly, without the size and inconvenience (to me, at least) of putting on additional lens, etc. The software that came with the camera also provides me with an easy way to trim, reduce red-eye and a number of other features. This Canon PowerShot well deserves the 5 stars I've awarded it. Incidentally, I discovered this particular model while talking to a fellow bus traveler in Mount Rushmore....we were so impressed with the viewing surface. M. Schanapp
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: you look better in the pic than real lfe...
customer_reviews.text: Takes amazing pictures, the color looks amazing and NEVER washes people out...taking pictures with this camera,makes the pictures look better than all other cameras and better looking than real life...I have owned ALOT of different brands, and by far this is my favorite...Years ago I had a 35mm canon and it was my favorite,until I used the life out of it...so I knew I wanted to spend a little extra money to get another canon,thank god I did!..you will not be disapointed! Video: Unlike some digital cameras, this camera you can zoom in and out after starting the video.And the sound is great too...
customer_reviews.author: donial

customer_reviews.title: Okay. Pro: wide-angle and optical zoom, decent ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay. Pro: wide-angle and optical zoom, decent sized images. Con: somewhat noisy images.
customer_reviews.author: citizenDAK

customer_reviews.title: Great in many ways
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very pleased with this camera. The quality for such a small camera is very good and the 12x zoom is fantastic. I have had trouble with the HD video filming for longer than 30 seconds or so. For some reason it just cuts of and saves the video. Smaller videos appear to be fine. I have looked at settings but can't seem to see anything restricting the length of the video. Overall a great buy in such a small camera.
customer_reviews.author: BadBrad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome images and HD Video
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little concerned about what I might get, but it was unfounded. Other than the small problem where my finger sometimes holds down the flash (it's in a bad position), this is an amazing camera. It's my first Canon, and I was not disappointed. I took this on a trip to Central America into some rough country and it held up well. Also, the HD video was of amazing quality. The sound was way better than I have ever heard on a camera like this, and the picture quality was first class. This was a great buy! I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Mason IV

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we were expecting. Quick ship and even gave us an unexpected SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera
customer_reviews.text: Great point and shoot with some more customizable options. Large to fit in a pocket
customer_reviews.author: William S.

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for a my novice photographer husband. It takes great pictures and the manual makes it easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl S.

customer_reviews.title: As a put in your pocket point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: ...it is easy, lots of pixels, fast, all in all for what it is a great grab and go camera with very good results.
customer_reviews.author: Not_you

customer_reviews.title: powershot sx200IS
customer_reviews.text: This product came in a timely manner. It was packaged in its original box with all its instructions and warranties. The camera is light weight and easy to adjust from one mode to the next. The battery life is excellent I can charge it and use it over the next 2-3 weeks without another charge. The product is well made and solid it is a little bulky but if your looking for a pocket camera this is not it but it easily slide into a jacket pocket or purse.
customer_reviews.author: t.l.g.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Bought 2!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Takes really good pictures for such a small footprint. Hard to be Canon glass. So good bought a second for my brother.
customer_reviews.author: HBouquet

customer_reviews.title: Peter Vicinio's review.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Canon camera. I am now sold on the Canon brand. It is a great value and has all the bells and whistles that I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter V.

customer_reviews.title: I love love love this camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is so easy to use and takes the most beautiful pictures I have ever had....I would definitely buy this exact same camera again if anything ever happened to the one I have.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ottinger

customer_reviews.title: Lens Error
customer_reviews.text: It's a great camera when it worked. I was one of the unlucky ones who got a lens error. Had it for 1 year. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Smartbox7

customer_reviews.title: GREAT POINT AND SHOOT EXCELLENT QUALITY OF THE PICS
customer_reviews.text: GREAT POINT AND SHOOT EXCELLENT QUALITY OF THE PICS.I HAVE 5D MARK III ,BUT FROM TIME TO TIME I AM GETTING BACK TO THIS ONE:-)
customer_reviews.author: Rosen Stoev-TOTTI

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for taking wildlife shots. With a combined 48x zoom, you can take closeups from 100's of yards away.
customer_reviews.author: H. Miller

customer_reviews.title: wonderful advanced amateur cam!
customer_reviews.text: this camera takes amazing pics, the super zoom is wonderful and crystal clear, the numerous functions/settings make picture taking even more enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: daKine34

customer_reviews.title: Third one
customer_reviews.text: I find this to be an excellent product, On my third after drowning one and dropping another down big rocks. Preferred buying another one rather than risking a newer model.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Otter

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the quality of photos taken, and surprised at length of battery life. Charged once a month ago and still using. I am a little disappoint with flash location and its pop up for I seem to always have my finger over it and hope it does not get damaged from holding down.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph E. Garside

customer_reviews.title: Lens Error, Restart Camera
customer_reviews.text: After only 5 months my this camera has quit working for me. I'm getting the now infamous "Lens Error, Restart Camera" message and apparently there is nothing Canon will do about it. I checked online to see if I might be able to fix the problem myself but all I found were other disgruntled buyers with the same issue. Very sad indeed. Anyway, just thought I would share this with everyone who was thinking of buying this camera. Please call Canon and ask them what you should do if you get this error message, there answer might be the best indicator as to whether you should buy this camera or not.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cantu

customer_reviews.title: Picture Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The camera is easy to use, takes stunning pictures, and has a nice look. I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna S.

customer_reviews.title: canon powershot sx200is review
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is small and sleek and takes the best pictures I have ever taken. The zoom is incredible so I can be far away and get those candid shots no problem. My hand shakes a little but this camera takes care of that. It also takes care of red eye. Want a small powerful no fuss camera...this one is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for my self and everyone loved it had to buy two more for husband and daughter in law so they would quit using mine.......lol
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: Real Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera app. 4 months ago and every time I use it, I just find something new and amazing about it. This user friendly canon makes photographing so easy and fun. Everyone thinking to have a semi-professional camera should buy it. This is a confession of a longtime nikon fan...
customer_reviews.author: Burcu

customer_reviews.title: Best I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: It is so easy to use! But also take the best pictures of any camera I've ever owned! The pictures in low light have even turned out! I haven't even had to use anything but auto yet! If I try manual who knows how much more I can do! The zoom is so much more then I've got with any other camera. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Hettinga

customer_reviews.title: Not fast enough
customer_reviews.text: My Canon Digital Elph from 2005 has a slightly faster shutter speed. I like to catch action, and although this camera takes incredibly better photos than my Elph, the frames per second are severely lacking for 5 years later if you want to continuous shoot and get some action shots. It's a bit big and the battery does not last as long as my 2005 camera either. I did return it, just waiting for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Nanzilla

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Small. Manual and automatic. Great videos. Great price. Holds a charge for a long time. Fits in jean pockets.
customer_reviews.author: FGL

customer_reviews.title: bought this camera for an Italian tour.
customer_reviews.text: What I dislike is the lens won't open all the way. Had it fixed once, and it happened again. Frustrating for a good camera such as this.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Leone

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot Sx200IS
customer_reviews.text: Small enough to fit in a pocket and powerful enough to get close-ups without all the attachments one has to carry with bigger cameras. As a teacher and Mother it fits all my needs in a camera
customer_reviews.author: Emily Ginko

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Large camera features and functionality in a small package. Zoom and lens stabilization are super. Image quality top notch. Good battery life. And it all fits in your pocket. No regrets buying this camera.
customer_reviews.author: WRS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality !!
customer_reviews.text: absolutely great quality of pictures (i receive this one in less time than expected) simple line : great camera and by a great price...!
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Dyck

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX200IS 12 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Black)
customer_reviews.text: I think it is an excellent choice if you want a compact camera with many functions and an excellent optical zoom. it takes great pictures in different ways you handle.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ocampo

customer_reviews.title: Fast, great images. Excellent Zoom!
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. Only drawback is that it does not have a viewfinder so you cannot conserve battery by turning off the LCD.
customer_reviews.author: Jitesh Mehta

customer_reviews.title: Overall good camera
customer_reviews.text: Good: 12x zoom, wide angle, picture quality, HD video, scene modes, face detection timer, eye closed sensor, NTSC/PAL, manual settings, color accent, color swap. Bad: No optical zoom while video capture, flash remain outside all the time when camera is on. Overall a good camera.
customer_reviews.author: S ks

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: I debated over this and the G10. I chose the SX200 because of the zoom. It takes excellent photos! It is not a tiny pocket camera. It has some weight and size to it. Excellent job Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Coal Monger

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the picture quality, ease of using, and size. Not too big, not too small.
customer_reviews.author: Donna McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it and carries it everywhere we go! Great product. Thanks Canon
customer_reviews.author: Donna K. Schirmer

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot SX200IS
customer_reviews.text: Best camera. Easy to use, easy to carry. Great resolution. Great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia De Caravantes

customer_reviews.title: The compact camera with more professional features
customer_reviews.text: Has more variables to adjust and personalize than comparable offers from other brands.
customer_reviews.author: G. Arteaga

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic. I wish it were a little smaller. Other than that, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: A. Harms

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camaera for my wife for Christmas It has never worked right. Cammera freezes in the open position and will not turn off until I removed the battery. Then we must recharge the battery and it will do it again after just a few pictures are taken. Never should have bought it .
customer_reviews.author: Greg Harley

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Flawed camera
customer_reviews.text: When this camera works, it works beautifully. But......I have had two and both suffered from the same flaw: after some use the lens jams (sometimes opened and sometimes closed) and the camera becomes inoperable. I sent the first one back to Amazon and received a replacement; the second one malfunctioned after the return period expired so now it has to be sent to an authorized repair center that I have yet to find. I can understand this happening once but twice on two separate cameras indicates a design flaw, making it a camera to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Wal50

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera- the macro is just as amazing as I expected. My only complaint is that the image quality is a little worse in low light, but that may be just in comparison to the superb macro images.
customer_reviews.author: Becka

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS CAMERA ON A CHANCE. I LOVE IT. TAKES GREAT PIX, ESPECIALLY GREAT FOR DARK SETTINGS AS CAMERA ADJUSTS AUTOMATICALLY WHEN SET ON AUTO MODE. GREAT PRICE FOR THE QUALITY OF PIX TAKEN.
customer_reviews.author: HELENA W

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: this camera is between easy ones and professional ones. relatively easy to use and the pictures have high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shihai He

customer_reviews.title: another hit from Canon
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased Canon's PowerShot SX200IS. I have fount it easy to use with lots of options. It takes great pictures. The only thing I don't think is well done as the rest of the caamera is the flash but overall it is a great camera and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy with camera, want to return it
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in the camera's ability- or NON-ability to focus in midrange. Had one before and this is why I bought another, but it will not focus from 3 ft to about 20 feet with zoom
customer_reviews.author: mary furness

customer_reviews.title: new all-in-one camera
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's easy to use and takes great pictures. It's small enuf to take with me all the time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Isaacson

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: The camera is heavy and hunky -- definitely too bulky to carry in my purse. But much more important: It takes lousy pictures. Photos taken on automatic are out of focus and poorly exposed. I could not wait to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital camera but it's easy to use so far. I'm learning how and this camera makes it very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Not found as anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Review of the camera was very good. So, decided to buy it. Picture qualities were not as expected. Surprisingly my older canon powershot 650 IS produced better pic than this camera.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Fatal "lens error" message
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked great for 9 weeks then I got a "lens error" and now it's too late to return it to Amazon and Canon won't fix it. Don't risk buying this camera.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gentry

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot SX200IS 12 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackCreating gorgeous images is more fun than ever with the sleek, impressively-equipped PowerShot SX200 IS. Capture close-up, wide-angle shots with stunning 12x optical zoom. Experience the unprecedented image quality and point-and-shoot convenience of Smart AUTO, along with enhanced operability and an intuitive new menu. HD shooting at 1280 x 720 pixels with HDMI output lets you see all the beauty of your HD images and movies on your HDTV.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Creating gorgeous images is more fun than ever with the sleek, impressively-equipped PowerShot SX200 IS. Capture close-up, wide-angle shots with stunning 12x optical zoom. Experience the unprecedented image quality and point-and-shoot convenience of Smart AUTO, along with enhanced operability and an intuitive new menu. HD shooting at 1280 x 720 pixels with HDMI output lets you see all the beauty of your HD images and movies on your HDTV. 

PowerShot SX200 IS Highlights 



12.1-megapixel resolution, 12x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer
For all its easy operability, the PowerShot SX200 IS has a feature set to be reckoned with. 12.1-megapixel resolution delivers a wealth of detail to every image, and allows you to crop and enlarge any portion of your shot freely. With the camera’s powerful 12x optical zoom, you’ll get up close fast, handy at sports and school events as well as everyday creative shooting. The 28mm wide-angle lens captures more in every frame, and gives your photography a professional edge. 

The PowerShot SX200 IS is equipped with Canon’s acclaimed Optical Image Stabilizer Technology that automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you’ll be proud to shoot and share. And Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer Technology is so convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 

Capture Your Best Shots Easily 

Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot SX200 IS to Smart AUTO and you’re ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It’s a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you’re photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you’re getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Shooting Modes 
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 23 Shooting Modes including 11 Special Scene Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way 

HD movie shooting capability plus HDMI output
The PowerShot SX200 IS lets you record video in beautiful high definition (1280 x 720 pixels). The camera also makes it easy to enjoy HD movies (and still photos) on your HDTV with an mini-HDMI connector for direct connection to a high-definition monitor. You’ll enjoy the HD experience with no degradation of image or audio in the signal, plus the ability to display up to 130 still images at once. 

Blink Detection
Blinking subjects can ruin the best shots, and the problem usually isn’t detected until it’s too late to do anything about it. The PowerShot SX200 IS is equipped with Canon’s new Blink Detection to combat this common image flaw. The feature uses the power of Face Detection to determine whether any subject in the previous shot had closed eyes. If closed eyes are detected, a "blink warning" icon appears for 3 seconds, allowing you to retake the shot before your subject or subjects move on. 

3.0-inch LCD with wide viewing angle
The camera’s high resolution (230,000 dots) 3.0-inch LCD with gives you the big picture, whether you’re shooting, reviewing or showing off your images. This high-resolution screen offers a crisp, clear picture to make shooting, playback and using the camera’s menu functions especially convenient. Clear and bright, it also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light. It also has an electronic viewfinder that provides sharp images when you shoot close-up with Super Macro shooting mode. 

A World of Advantages with Canon’s Technology 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor has evolved Face Detection Technology that tracks the faces of moving subjects and lets the shooter enter the frame seamlessly with the Face Detection Self-Timer. 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor
Canon’s most advanced image processor, DIGIC 4, delivers evolved Face Detection Technology that keeps every face in every photo looking its very best. The technology finds and tracks the faces of moving subjects until you’re ready to shoot, then delivers perfect focus. In addition, exposure, flash and white balance are compensated, so that faces exhibit natural skin tones and backgrounds are properly exposed. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the advanced DIGIC 4 image processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

A Face Detection Self-Timer automatically detects an increase in the number of faces and makes the appropriate adjustments. For instance, to include the photographer’s face in a group shot, there’s no need to rush in. Just put the camera on a stand or tripod, specify Face Detection Self-Timer, and the camera will wait for the photographer’s face to get on-camera before it takes the shot. Motion Detection tracks moving subjects in a much larger range, and the Servo AF retains focus on a moving subject after the shutter button is pressed halfway--allowing you to wait for the perfect shot without refocusing. 

Intelligent Contrast Correction
DIGIC 4 also makes possible the i-Contrast (Intelligent Contrast Correction) system, which controls the compensation level in pixel units to brighten dark areas while leaving bright areas unchanged for better images where the main subject is dark, and more natural transition. The PowerShot SX200 IS can even use i-Contrast in playback mode to adjust images that were shot without the setting activated. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures.
1) Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken.
2) The PowerShot SX200 IS can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback.
3) You can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Life doesn’t give you second chances to capture special times. That’s why the PowerShot SX200 IS features an ISO 1600 setting that reduces the effects of camera shake and sharpens subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. ISO can be expanded to 3200 when you select ISO 3200 Special Scene mode. 

What's in the Box

 * PowerShot SX200 IS body 
 * Lithium-ion battery pack (NB-5L) 
 * Battery charger (CB-2LX) 
 * Wrist strap (WS-DC9) 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB interface cable (IFC-400PCU) 
 * AV cable (AVC-DC400)
feature_bullets: Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)
3.0-inch LCD screen; Face Detection, Blink Detection
12x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer and 28mm wide-angle lens
12.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
HD movie shooting capability plus HDMI output
12.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
12x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer; 28mm wide-angle lens
HD movie shooting capability plus HDMI output
3.0-inch LCD screen; Face Detection, Blink Detection
Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)
